snippet: Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy wrote that a separation would involve “enormous cost” to the country, and suggested talks with the Catalonian leader instead.
abstract: Spanish Prime Min Mariano Rajoy rejects request by Artur Mas, leader of economically powerful region of Catalonia, to approve referendum that would allow his region to decide whether to secede from rest of country.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy wrote that a separation would involve “enormous cost” to the country, and suggested talks with the Catalonian leader instead.
